revised_title: Active Transport of Salts and Water in Insect Rectum
tldr: The article discusses the active transport of salts and water in the rectum of insects, focusing on two main structural lines: the cryptonephric line and the rectal gland line. These lines help in the removal of water from the faeces and maintain the osmotic balance in the insect's body. The author presents the structural complexity and physiological mechanisms of these lines, including the role of perirectal and subepithelial spaces in water reabsorption.
